title: Automating Content Publishing with n8n and GitHub
summary: Learn how to set up a workflow that automatically publishes markdown content to your GitHub repo using n8n's powerful automation features.
content:
Transform your content publishing process with this comprehensive guide to automating markdown workflows using n8n and GitHub.

🚀 Getting Started

1. Setup Prerequisites

  • ✅ Deploy n8n (cloud/local)
  • ✅ Required credentials:
    • GitHub Personal Access Token
    • Google Drive API OAuth2
    • Notion Integration Token
  • ✅ Prepare GitHub repo with content/ directory

2. Workflow Architectures

Google Drive to GitHub

  • 🔗 Nodes: Google Drive → HTTP Request → Function → GitHub
  • ⚡ Features: Scheduled triggers, Markdown conversion

💡 Expert Recommendations

Best Practices

  • 🔒 Secure credentials with environment variables
  • ✍️ Use meaningful commit messages
  • ⚙️ Validate Markdown syntax automatically

Common Pitfalls

  • ⏳ API rate limits - add delay nodes
  • 🔄 OAuth2 token expiration issues
  • 📁 Filename conflicts - use UUIDs

🔍 Sample Workflow


{
  "trigger": "Schedule (Daily)",
  "steps": [
    "Google Drive: List Files",
    "Function: Convert to Markdown",
    "GitHub: Commit to content/{filename}.md"
  ]
}
